benchmark_details.name: VTS (Visual Token Scaling)
benchmark_details.overview: VTS (Visual Token Scaling) is a new dataset that facilitates supervised reasoning trajectories (VTS-SFT) and preference-labeled reasoning comparisons (VTS-DPO) for visual reasoning tasks in multi-modal large language models (MLLMs), enabling dynamic and iterative visual inference.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To enhance multi-step visual reasoning by enabling models to iteratively select visual actions and verify their utility at each step.

data.source: Generated from visual reasoning examples in the LLaVA-OneVision dataset.
data.annotation: Automatically generated visual reasoning trajectories with filtering for correctness using LLM-based verification.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on the correctness of generated reasoning trajectories against ground-truth labels.
methodology.interpretation: Higher accuracy indicates better performance and reasoning capability of MLLMs.
methodology.baseline_results: Results from models using static visual token representation were significantly lower compared to those using VTS.

harm: Negative impacts on model output fairness due to biased reasoning trajectories.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: All data used was filtered to ensure no personal identifiable information was included.
ethical_and_legal_considerations.consent_procedures: Data was sourced from publicly available datasets and verified for correctness.
